alert.note: Alert for Putnam (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 12:24PM EDT until April 07 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Little River near Eatonton affecting Putnam County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Little River near Eatonton. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands and fields along the river of the Oconee National Forest upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway 16 or Monticello Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 20.1 feet and steady. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM EDT Thursday was 20.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 6.1 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 20 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.3 feet on 10/06/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
